title: Molly-Mae Hague lashes out at bold claims her relationship with Tommy Fury is fake
text:

Molly-Mae Hague hit out at trolls for calling her romance with Tommy Fury fake.

The Love Island beauty got protective of her relationship as she rubbished rumours their relationship is fake.

Speaking to Mirror Online at the Pride of Britain, she said: "I think we're proper over that now. I don't think anyone is saying that anymore.

"We're just happy to be here."

Tommy also echoed his girlfriend's sentiments that things were going well with their relationship.

The boxer gushed the couple were stronger than ever since making their new home in Manchester a lovenest.

"We've gone from strength to strength since moving in," he said.

(Image: Instagram)

As well as defending their blossoming romance, Molly-Mae and Tommy put on an amorous display on the red carpet.

However, it appeared to be a different story when the duo spent the rest of Pride of Britain "engrossed in their phones" according to eye-witnesses.

Sources spied Molly-Mae glued to her phone as she kept her 3.4million fans in the loop from the glittering event and she uploaded a number of stories.

(Image: PA)

The blonde bombshell was said only to look up to snap selfies with her adoring fans.

An eye-witness told The Mirror of the scene: "Tommy and Molly-Mae were utterly engrossed in their phones, despite this being their first ever Pride of Britain.

"They were sitting at the same table as Ferne McCann, Molly didn't seem at all interested in chatting to the other celebs or even her own boyfriend.

(Image: Doug Peters/EMPICS Entertainment)

"The only time she looked up was when some girls came over to take some selfies with Tommy, then she went straight back to Instagramming."

Molly-Mae took to Instagram to document her glamorous look as she dressed her figure in one of her own designs.

Meanwhile, Tommy shared a cute couple snap to delight their admirers.

They narrowly missed out on the £50K prize fund on Love Island when they came second to now broken up Amber Gill and Greg O'Shea.

The Daily Mirror Pride of Britain Awards, in partnership with TSB, will broadcast on ITV on 5th November at 8pm
description: EXCLUSIVE: Molly-Mae and Tommy have blasted rumours their relationship is fake when they discuss blossoming romance
